unnormalised: **Question: Is it safe to give my full address online when selling something?**
normalised: **Question: Is it safe to give my full address online when selling something?**

unnormalised: Well, bhai, that depends on what you're selling! If it's your old cycle, probably no big deal if you give out "House No. 27, Shastri Nagar, Meerut, UP, 250002". But if it's, say, a kidney, maybe keep things a bit more discreet, no? Jokes aside, think about what you're comfortable with. Giving just the area, like "Near Gol Market, Karol Bagh, Delhi, 110005" might be enough to coordinate a meetup without broadcasting your exact pin code to every Tom, Dick, and Harry online.
normalised: Well, bhai, that depends on what you are selling! If it is your old cycle, probably no big deal if you give out "House Number twenty seven, Shastri Nagar, Meerut, U-P, two hundred and fifty thousand and two". But if it is, say, a kidney, maybe keep things a bit more discreet, no? Jokes aside, think about what you are comfortable with. Giving just the area, like "Near Gol Market, Karol Bagh, Delhi, one hundred and ten thousand and five" might be enough to coordinate a meetup without broadcasting your exact pin code to every Tom, Dick, and Harry online.

unnormalised: Seriously though, in India, giving your full address - “Bunglow No 4, Saraswati Enclave, Behind SBI Bank, Panjim, Goa, 403001”- can open you up to unwanted attention. Especially if you're listing something valuable. Online scammers are as common as mosquitoes in the monsoon, and they'll use any info they can get. Better safe than sorry, right?

unnormalised: So, my two paisa? Give the general area, maybe a landmark like "Opposite City Centre Mall, Sector 12, Dwarka, Delhi, 110075", and arrange the final meetup in a public place. Let the buyer come to your turf, not the other way around! And for the love of samosas, don't give your address until you're absolutely sure the buyer is legit. Happy selling!
